column4: Same white screen, although the cursor does change over certain areas, so it appears to be a video issue.
Although gnome doesn't seem to think it has any problems.
Well.. gnome boots up, shows the login screen.
Once I log in, it goes white with moveable cursor.
The cursor does change to eyebeam over certain places. So gnome probably thinks it is fine.
I've been switching in and out of console using Ctrl-Alt-F2 & F7 as shey suggested.
But naturally I can't startx as gnome is currently running.
how about the xorg.conf? can you pasebinit?
sudo apt-get install pasebinit then pastebinit /etc/X11/Xorg.conf
there is no defined video driver in your xorg.conf.. the default is vesa wish may not be supporting your card.. its a generic driver
Even though the login screen works fine?
just a suggestion.. i would start making backups of your file before making changes :) even with dpkg
Ctrl+Alt+backspace should do the trick.. yes
